topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557a6f416368721bb600053e#post_557a6f416368721bb600053e
This is biased as fuck, but consoles are sales wise having a really hard time right now.

!http://techgage.com/articles/editorials/september_11/nvidia_trends_01.png!

Why is pc gaming beating consoles?  Simply put a $400 computer is still more powerful than even the ps4.  My computer costed me $500 and it's four times more powerful than the ps4.

The other thing is we've reached the maximum graphical capability.

Before the rise of consoles: "PC gaming is the future!"
Rise of consoles to 2013: "Consoles have better graphics!"
Today: "Consoles are performance wise outdated!"

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557a719363687217ab001796#post_557a719363687217ab001796
The only reason that I have a console instead of a gaming computer is because that I don't know how to make one. People don't deliberately sell gaming computers. You have to build one yourself. And it's kinda hard for me for many reasons.

1. I don't know anything about it.
2. There isn't any good computer stores here.
3. The parts aren't cheap.
4. I'm afraid I might fuck up.
5. There are no PC games here that aren't pirated.
6. I have no place to put one.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

plus steam sales are crazy good savings and who wants to miss out on that

Plus I do not have the know how to build one. like HJ just said what if I fuck it up?

And besides that I go back to the money again. don't have that kind of money to just blow on something. Especially if I don't know what I'm doing. 

Besides like I said I don't really care, I just want to play a video game. I mean can we not have to go into a discussion about the superior platform every single time?

Now I'm going to bed.

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557a73e863687217ab001ba2#post_557a73e863687217ab001ba2
Don't worry; at the rate computers are going a wrist watch will be able to play Crysis 3 in ten years. . . That's not a joke either; it's totally biased of me, but I don't see consoles continuing to exist in ten years cause by 2020 your average $1000 (counting inflation) desktop computer will be as powerful as a human brain.  There might be a ps5/xbox2.0/wiiu2 or such, but it would be 100% financial suicide to continue to invest in consoles in the long run.

The next generation of consoles will be legitimately be the last cause if anyone makes a console post ~2020 it would be about as smart as playing russian roulette with 6 bullets.

Tl:dr; if your average computer in five years will be as powerful as the human brain computation per second wise then what is the point of making consoles?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
